alert.note: Alert for Northern Westchester; Rockland (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 25 at 3:02PM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Bergen, northern Westchester and Rockland Counties through 345 PM EDT... At 302 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Pearl River, or over Nanuet, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... New City, Ossining, Peekskill, Monsey, Nanuet, Haverstraw, Tarrytown, Nyack, Tappan, Greenwich, Pearl River, Hawthorne, Orangeburg, Upper Nyack and Spring Valley. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for southern Connecticut...northeastern New Jersey...and southeastern New York.
